raw_mentions:
MAS-7 induces strong [<sup>35</sup>S] GTPγS binding on HT cells with an EC50 of about 5 μm (FIG. 2).
Maximum binding is reached at about 25 to 50 μm MAS-7. 
The binding of [<sup>35</sup>S] GTPγS to hypertensive cells is distinctly speeded up (rate constants 0.005 s<sup>−1 </sup>in the normotensive versus 0.01 s<sup>−1 </sup>in the hypertensive state).
It is evident that the maximum stimulated binding of [<sup>35</sup>S] GTPγS to membranes from hypertensives occurs at lower concentrations of GDP (about 0.2 μmol/l), where a concentration of 1 μmol/l GDP is required for the same effect in normotensives.
In a similar way, the maximum binding, stimulated by mastoparan 7, of [<sup>35</sup>S] GTPγS to membrane preparations from hypertensive cells a low concentration of free Mg<sup>2+ </sup>(about 0.01 mmol/l), while a free Mg<sup>2+</sup> concentration of 0.1 mmol/l is necessary for the same maximum binding of [<sup>35</sup>S] GTPγS to membrane
